name: Naoussa
description: Get lost in the narrow white-washed labyrinth of bougainvillea draped houses, local boutiques and coffee shops, or sample the islands freshest seafood along the waterfront of its colourful picturesque harbour. Although considered one of the most beautiful villages in the Cyclades, Naoussa is definitely more than just a pretty face! Calm and tranquil by day, this cosmopolitan village truly comes to life after the sun sets, with a vibrant nightlife where you can really let your hair down and dance until dawn.

content.name: Soso
content.description: ‘A small, elegant restaurant offering generous portions of Greek fusion cuisine

content.name: Ragoussis Bakery
content.description: Coffee, juice, sandwiches, ice cream and freshly baked pastries and cakes

content.name: Taverna Glafkos
content.description: Mediterranean seafood on the sands of Agios Dimitrios Beach

content.name: Paradosiako
content.description: The best dessert in Paros - famous for their Loukoumades!

content.name: Agosta
content.description: A small bar that packs a big (lively) punch!

content.name: Sante of Paros
content.description: Cocktails mixed with flair, accompanied by an equally flavoursome soundtrack

content.name: Kosmos
content.description: The locals say this place serves up the most delicious cocktails on the island

content.name: Linardo
content.description: A who’s who of DJs have passed through the pink doors of this historic bar

content.name: Paros Park
content.description: Follow the beautiful walking trails and explore the rock formations, caves, hidden coves, beaches and traces of history this park is home to

content.name: Moraitis Winery
content.description: Take home a taste of Paros from this 110 year old family-run winery

content.name: Aqua Paros
content.description: Attached to the Porto Paros Hotel, this waterpark features a lazy river and 13 water slides all ending in the Aegean sea

content.name: Agean Tennis Centre
content.description: A high quality tennis centre set against the backdrop of the natural landscape of Paros

content.name: Handmade With Love in Paros
content.description: A collection of vibrant and colourful locally-made accessories, including make-up bags and leather sandals

content.name: Hera’s Gallery Shop
content.description: Chic modern Greek design pieces, perfect for that one of a kind gift - they also have a gorgeous selection of Turkish towels!

content.name: Artisun
content.description: Handmade jewellery, handbags and accessories using traditional craftsmanship and eco-friendly materials and methods

content.name: White in Paros
content.description: An uber-chic fashion boutique. Warning: you’ll want to buy everything!

content.name: Kolymbithres
content.description: One of the most famous beaches on Paros, featuring impressive rock formations

content.name: Monastiri
content.description: Surrounded by huge rocky hills, this little bay has its own restaurant and bar

content.name: Piperi
content.description: A tiny scenic beach, perfect for snorkelling or fishing, among its rocks

content.name: Agioi Anargyroi
content.description: A small secluded beach, partly organised with sunbeds and umbrellas

content.name: Bohemian Boutique Hotel
content.description: This hotel offers compact luxury living by combining modern design and contemporary amenities with bohemian spirit!

content.name: Mr & Mrs White
content.description: A secluded state of the art new style hotel that pampers you with tailor made service and state of the art facilities

content.name: Kanale’s Rooms & Suites
content.description: Nestled among different levels of the hillside, this small boutique hotel has sweeping views across the Aegean sea to Mykonos

content.name: Astir of Paros
content.description: Tucked away in a unique landscape surrounded by colourful tropical gardens and exotic trees, this 5 star luxury resort features its own private beach

name: Parikia
description: As the Island’s capital, this little town is the commercial and cultural hub of Paros and home to the main harbour. For its small size, Parikia packs a real punch with its old town offering up a huge selection of boutique shops, cafes and restaurants and a bustling coastal promenade lined with tavernas and bars. For those looking to soak up some culture and history, take to the streets by foot or rented bicycle and explore the impressive archaeological sites and museums.

content.name: Levantis
content.description: Contemporary Greek cuisine combining traditional dishes with modern Mediterranean flavours

content.name: Albatros
content.description: This long-running seafood ouzerí may not look like much compared to its flashier neighbours, but the platters are amazing!

content.name: Aromas
content.description: A traditional Greek taverna with vegan and gluten free options

content.name: Coralli
content.description: Situated on Livadia beach this is a great spot for watching the sunset – we highly recommend the risotto!

content.name: Bebop
content.description: A gorgeous rooftop bar perfect for sundowners

content.name: Sativa
content.description: Good music, good vibes and super-sized cocktails

content.name: Pirate Bar
content.description: This hidden-gem is open from early evening until the break of dawn

content.name: Kiaola
content.description: A beachfront bar with mainstream vibes playing music from all decades that ends each and every night with a very Greek bang!

content.name: Visit Antiparos
content.description: Paros’ sister island is only a short ferry ride away – look out for Tom Hanks who spends his summer here every year!

content.name: Panagia Ekatontapiliani
content.description: Better known as the Church of 100 doors, this beautiful complex dates back to 326 AD

content.name: Archaeological Museum
content.description: Founded in 1960 this important museum displays artefacts discovered on Paros and Antiparos that date back to the neolithic period

content.name: Frankish Castle
content.description: One of the most enduring monuments on the island of Paros, built in the 1200s by the Venetian Sanoudos

content.name: Atelier 1935
content.description: A gorgeous selection of, comfortable handmade Cretan leather sandals

content.name: Jazmin
content.description: Local natural cosmetics including custom-made perfumes for the girls and beard care for the boys!

content.name: Melissa
content.description: A concept life and style gift store, perfect for grabbing your fun and funky souvenirs! #IHeartGreece

content.name: Jewellery by Poulopoulos
content.description: Established 42 years ago, this handmade Greek jewellery store can also be found on Etsy!

content.name: Krios
content.description: A sandy beach sheltered from the wind, with restaurants that offer free sunbeds and umbrellas with any purchase

content.name: Marchello
content.description: A bustling beach that consists of a series of secluded rocky coves

content.name: Kaminia
content.description: A long, relaxing, unorganised beach with short vegetation, at the entrance of Parikia Bay

content.name: Agios Fokas
content.description: A small, hidden beach perfect for peace and privacy

content.name: Sunset View Hotel
content.description: Built amphitheatrically above the town of Parikia in a unique traditional island style, this hotel offers spectacular sunset views

content.name: Archipelagos Resort Hotel
content.description: This stunning 5 star luxury hotel features 30 suites and 3 family villas, contemporarily designed and inspired by the island’s local architecture

content.name: Paros Palace
content.description: This newly renovated hotel offers calm and tranquil surroundings while still only a short distance from the vibrant city centre of Parikia

content.name: White Blossom
content.description: Spacious and comfortable apartments just a few steps from Livadia beach, promising a quiet and relaxing stay

name: Santa Maria
description: Perfect for those looking to relax and soak up the sun on Paros’ more remote and off-the-beaten path beaches, while still remaining in close proximity to the bustling nightlife of Naoussa fishing village. Santa Maria’s beautiful coastline is divided into two golden sand beaches, both with gorgeous views of the neighbouring Naxos island, and crystal-clear waters perfect for snorkelling or taking advantage of the various watersports on offer. You’ll also find Paros’ best beach bar on the organised section of this beach, serving up fresh fruity cocktails and a delicious lunch and dinner menu!

content.name: Koom & Santa Maria Beach Bar
content.description: Situated side by side, these lively restaurants are the perfect place to sample dishes made from fresh seasonal ingredients or simply sip on a cocktail and enjoy the sea breeze

content.name: To Dixty
content.description: Beginning as fishermen who sold their catch of the day to nearby businesses – this family decided to open their own restaurant in North Santa Maria aptly named To ‘Dixty’, which translates as The ‘Net’

content.name: White Dunes
content.description: Attached to the exclusive White Dunes Hotel, this fine dining restaurant features amazing sea views and elegant decoration details.

content.name: Katsoynas
content.description: A traditional family-run Greek fish taverna located in Northern Santa Maria that is famed for its succulent pork chops and homemade moussaka

tabs.name: Drink
tabs.description: While the two beach bars stay open late into the evening so you can boogie in your bikini, there are also countless bars and nightclubs to explore in nearby fishing village Naoussa, which can be reached (by car) in 10mins.

tabs.name: Do
tabs.description: Sun. Sand. Sea. Life’s a beach! For more adventurous activity options, please see the other map locations which are all only a short drive away.

tabs.name: Shop
tabs.description: Seashells are free, so fill your boots! However, if you’re looking to splash the cash, head to nearby Naoussa, Parikia or Lefkes to shop ‘til you drop!

tabs.name: Beach
tabs.description: Good news…it IS the beach - YAY!

content.name: White Dunes
content.description: A luxurious 12 suite resort with amazing sea views, only 2 minutes walk from the beach

content.name: Seven
content.description: This ultra-stylish boutique hotel features 6 rooms and 1 villa and is situated a mere 30 metres from the little bay of Mikri Santa Maria beach

content.name: Ambassador Luxury Villas
content.description: A gorgeous upscale villa complex on the water’s edge, with a large pool and spacious terrace

content.name: The Sand Collection Villas
content.description: 5 lavish villas and 3 charming suites designed in deluxe modern Cycladic flair, a stone’s throw from the beach

name: Lefkes
description: This first capital of Paros, located at the very centre of the island, surrounded by mountains and offering breath-taking views of the neighbouring Cyclades islands. Lefkes is one of the prettiest and most traditional villages on the island, featuring whitewashed houses mixed with Venetian architecture, wonderful churches dating from the 15th century and the olive trees and windmills Greece is famous for! It’s also the perfect starting point for the many hiking trails Paros has to offer, including the famous Byzantine Road.

content.name: Aranto
content.description: Simple, locally-sourced, authentic Cyclades dishes served on a huge terrace where you can enjoy sweeping views of the wild landscapes of Paros

content.name: Ramnos Cafe
content.description: Located on (and named after) the Central street of the village, this café serves up the Island’s most delicious crepes!

content.name: Lefkiano
content.description: Offering generous portions of mouth-watering Mediterranean cuisine, this cosy little restaurant is a hidden gem among the winding paths of Lefkes

content.name: Kafeneio Marigos
content.description: Situated opposite Agia Triada church, it’s the perfect place to take a break from exploring and enjoy a slice of cake with a cup of coffee or glass of homemade lemonade

tabs.name: Drink
tabs.description: This sleepy little village is definitely not a hotspot for those seeking a vibrant nightlife. We’d recommend making the 20 minute journey (by car) to Parikia or Naoussa, where there are countless bars and nightclubs to explore.

content.name: The Byzantine Road
content.description: Dating back to 1,000 AD, this 3.5km (majority flat/downhill) trail is the oldest on the island, and connects Lefkes to Prodromos

content.name: Agia Triada Church
content.description: Known for its intricate bell towers, this church is the second largest on the island and has an impressive interior with elaborate frescoes and artistic features

content.name: The Folklore Art Museum
content.description: All exhibits in this Parian museum were generously donated by the locals in the hopes of preserving the cultural character and history of Lefkes

content.name: Rent a bike
content.description: See and experience as much of the island as possible - without the sore feet! And if you’re feeling really lazy, quad bikes are also available

content.name: ONEipa Concept Store
content.description: Creative and tasteful designs in homeware and clothing, including scarves by felt designer, Elena Kyriakakou

content.name: Blackrose
content.description: A fabulous little gift store with a variety of affordable locally made items to suit all tastes

content.name: Keramiko
content.description: A handmade ceramic dinnerware and home décor store, with an onsite workshop where you can watch the production process

content.name: Chorochronos
content.description: Owned by local artist, Marina Triantafyllou, this gallery specialises in traditional Greek iconography, pottery, and modern marble sculpture and jewellery

tabs.name: Beach
tabs.description: Being on a verdant hill 300m above sea level, it’s no surprise that Lefkes is unable to offer the stunning Cycladic island beaches you’ve been dreaming of. Luckily, as the central point of the Island, you can set off in virtually any direction and hit a beach within 20 mins (by car)!

content.name: Lefkes Village Hotel
content.description: A 4-star hotel surrounded by 20 acres of fruit trees and gardens, a community of traditional houses and a private museum of popular Aegean civilisation

content.name: Traditional Stone-built Windmill
content.description: A 19th century windmill renovated as a house, with magnificent views of the village and out to the sea, only 5 mins walk from Lefkes

content.name: Green House
content.description: An eco-friendly, solar energy powered Cycladic stone house in the centre of the village, with breath-taking sea views and a lush garden full of fruit trees

content.name: Luxury Modern Apartment
content.description: A newly renovated apartment with contemporary interior design and a private shaded terrace
